meanings.definition: Praise or express approval for someone or something.
meanings.sent1: I commend my friend for helping me with my homework.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will commend the students for their hard work.
meanings.sent3: I commend the cat for catching the mouse, even though it was a bit clumsy.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work truly commends her to all who know her.
meanings.sent5: The shining trophy will commend the winner's efforts for years to come.

meanings.definition: Entrust someone or something to another's care.
meanings.sent1: I commend my pet fish to my neighbor while I am on vacation.
meanings.sent2: The parents commend their child to the babysitter for the evening.
meanings.sent3: I commend my favorite book to you, but please return it when you're done.
meanings.sent4: She commended her precious jewelry to the safekeeping of the bank.
meanings.sent5: The captain commended the ship to the experienced hands of the first mate.

meanings.definition: Recommend as worthy of confidence or notice.
meanings.sent1: I commend this restaurant for its delicious food and excellent service.
meanings.sent2: The doctor will commend this medication for its effectiveness.
meanings.sent3: I commend this movie to anyone looking for a good laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her skills and dedication commend her as a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent5: The glowing reviews commend this new product to consumers seeking quality.
